definitions.definition: A mode of transportation, often a train, that travels quickly or directly.
definitions.example: I took the express into town.

definitions.definition: A service that allows mail or money to be sent rapidly from one destination to another.
A clear image or representation; an expression; a plain declaration.
A messenger sent on a special errand; a courier.
That which is sent by an express messenger or message.
Moving or operating quickly, as a train not making local stops.
Specific or precise; directly and distinctly stated; not merely implied.
definitions.example: I gave him express instructions not to begin until I arrived, but he ignored me.
In my eyes it bore a livelier image of the spirit, it seemed more express and single, than the imperfect and divided countenance.

definitions.definition: (retail) Providing a more limited but presumably faster service than a full or complete dealer of the same kind or type.
definitions.example: Some Wal-Mart stores will include a McDonald's Express.

definitions.definition: The action of conveying some idea using words or actions; communication, expression.
To convey or communicate; to make known or explicit.
definitions.example: Words cannot express the love I feel for him.

definitions.definition: To press, squeeze out (especially said of milk).
To translate messenger RNA into protein.
To transcribe deoxyribonucleic acid into messenger RNA.
